remarks: The "constant function" function which maps ` x e. Y ` to the constant function ` z e. X |-> x ` is a continuous function from ` X ` into the space of continuous functions from ` Y ` to ` X ` .  This can also be understood as the currying of the first projection function.  (The currying of the second projection function is ` x e. Y |-> ( z e. X |-> z ) ` , which we already know is continuous because it is a constant function.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Mar-2015.)
